entry.title: Kaikōura community remains resilient after earthquake and pandemic

media:group.media:title: Kaikōura community remains resilient after earthquake and pandemic
media:group.media:description: It’s small-town New Zealand that’s been hit harder than most. In 2016, Kaikōura was hit by a 7.8 magnitude earthquake – cutting off the town in an instant, and taking two years of struggle to rebuild and re-open. This summer, the tourists had finally begun to flood back, and the future was looking bright. Until Covid-19 hit. But Kaikōura is also a community of resilience and optimism. We visit the locals and see what they’re doing, how they’re coping and what advice they have for the rest of us.

media:group.media:title: The Spike Hunters
media:group.media:description: New Zealand scientists are part of the worldwide hunt for a vaccine for Covid-19. Even if we do eliminate the virus here, they say it could take just one super-spreader arriving at our borders to bring the whole country down. Collaborating at research centres around the country, these experts are close to testing a formula on animals within weeks - although a vaccine safe for humans is still a long way off. Their vaccine formula is unique - building tiny synthetic spikes to stimulate the immune system – and to provide long-term protection.
